trans-unit.source: The array that contains the following information:

seg-source.mrk: The array that contains the following information:

target.mrk: The array that contains the following information:

trans-unit.source: [0] - The time that the system has been idle.

seg-source.mrk: [0] - The time that the system has been idle.

target.mrk: [0] - The time that the system has been idle.

trans-unit.source: [1] - The time that the system has spent executing in kernel mode, in 100-nanosecond time units.

seg-source.mrk: [1] - The time that the system has spent executing in kernel mode, in 100-nanosecond time units.

target.mrk: [1] - The time that the system has spent executing in kernel mode, in 100-nanosecond time units.

trans-unit.source: [2] - The time that the system has spent executing in user mode, in 100-nanosecond time units.

seg-source.mrk: [2] - The time that the system has spent executing in user mode, in 100-nanosecond time units.

target.mrk: [2] - The time that the system has spent executing in user mode, in 100-nanosecond time units.

trans-unit.source: Sets the @error flag to non-zero, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

seg-source.mrk: Sets the @error flag to non-zero, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

target.mrk: Sets the @error flag to non-zero, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

trans-unit.source: On a multiprocessor system, the _WinAPI_GetSystemTimes() returns a values are the sum of the designated times

seg-source.mrk: On a multiprocessor system, the _WinAPI_GetSystemTimes() returns a values are the sum of the designated times

target.mrk: On a multiprocessor system, the _WinAPI_GetSystemTimes() returns a values are the sum of the designated times
